quiz.title: Physics Grade 11: Forces - Conceptual Understanding
quiz.subtitle: Unit 2 Quiz 1: Newton's Laws & Force Concepts (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: A book rests on a table. According to Newton's Third Law, the force of the book on the table is equal and opposite to:
options: The force of gravity on the book
The force of the table on the book
The force of gravity on the table
The force of the book on the Earth
questions.explanation: Newton's Third Law states that for every action force there is an equal and opposite reaction force. The book pushing down on the table (action) is paired with the table pushing up on the book (reaction).

questions.question: A car accelerates forward on a level road. The force that directly causes this acceleration is:
options: The force of the engine on the drive wheels
The force of the road on the drive wheels
The force of air resistance backward
The force of gravity downward
questions.explanation: While the engine provides torque to the wheels, it's the friction between the tires and road (road pushing forward on the wheels) that propels the car forward. This is the external force causing acceleration.

questions.question: An object moves with constant velocity. According to Newton's First Law:
options: There must be no forces acting on it
The net force on it is zero
It has no inertia
It must be in free fall
questions.explanation: Newton's First Law states that an object in motion stays in motion with constant velocity unless acted upon by a net force. Constant velocity means zero net force, not necessarily zero individual forces.

questions.question: In a tug-of-war, when Team A pulls on the rope with 500 N and Team B pulls with 500 N, the tension in the rope is:
options: 0 N
questions.explanation: Tension is transmitted equally throughout a rope. Each team pulls with 500 N, creating 500 N of tension in the rope. The forces are equal and opposite, resulting in zero net force on the rope.

questions.question: A heavy truck and a light car have a head-on collision. According to Newton's Third Law:
options: The truck exerts more force on the car
The car exerts more force on the truck
They exert equal force on each other
The force depends on their speeds
questions.explanation: Newton's Third Law states the forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction. The truck might experience less acceleration due to its greater mass, but the force magnitudes are equal.

questions.question: A person pushes a heavy box but it doesn't move. The force of static friction between the box and floor:
options: Is zero
Is equal to the applied force
Is greater than the applied force
Depends only on the weight of the box
questions.explanation: Static friction matches the applied force up to its maximum value. Since the box doesn't move, the net force is zero, so static friction equals the applied force.

questions.question: An astronaut in the International Space Station appears weightless because:
options: There is no gravity in space
Gravity is much weaker at that altitude
She is in free fall along with the station
The station's rotation cancels gravity
questions.explanation: Gravity at the ISS altitude is about 90% of Earth's surface gravity. The astronaut and station are both in free fall toward Earth, creating the sensation of weightlessness.

questions.question: A ball is thrown upward. At the highest point of its trajectory:
options: Velocity is zero and acceleration is zero
Velocity is zero and acceleration is 9.8 m/s² downward
Velocity is 9.8 m/s upward and acceleration is zero
Velocity is 9.8 m/s downward and acceleration is 9.8 m/s² downward
questions.explanation: At the highest point, vertical velocity is momentarily zero as it changes from upward to downward. Acceleration due to gravity is constant at 9.8 m/s² downward throughout.

questions.question: When a car turns a corner at constant speed, which statement is true?
options: No net force acts on the car
A net force acts toward the center of the turn
A net force acts away from the center of the turn
The frictional force on the car is zero
questions.explanation: Changing direction requires a centripetal force. For a car turning, friction between tires and road provides this inward force toward the center of the turn.

questions.question: A skydiver falls at terminal velocity. This means:
options: Her acceleration is zero
She has stopped falling
Air resistance is zero
Gravity has stopped acting
questions.explanation: Terminal velocity occurs when air resistance equals weight. Net force becomes zero, so acceleration becomes zero. She continues falling at constant speed.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You have a strong conceptual understanding of Newton's Laws.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! You understand most concepts but review action-reaction pairs.
scoreMessages.50: Fair. Focus on distinguishing between velocity, acceleration, and forces.
scoreMessages.0: Review Newton's Three Laws and basic force concepts.
